title: Is Tenerife, Canary Islands a good choice for digital nomads? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not my intention to fuel the traditional rivalry between the two capital islands on the canarian archipelago, and of course it depends on your personal preferences, but it’s my impression that Gran Canaria is actually attracting more digital nomads. Those two are the main digital nomads specialized coworking spaces both on Tenerife and Gran Canaria. On their blogs they have post about the advantages of being a digital nomad on each island, and probably you could find some information of interest: Coworking and Coliving for Digital Nomads in Tenerife Coworking C

It depends of the nomadism degree you mean. Of course there are digital service providers, and enough critical mass of users to make a digital life feasible, but as the limate is so good and inviting, perhaps you’d not be happy enough by just enclosing yourself between walls, even if they were made of glass, as many almost are. Canarians are good folks in general, and there is a lot of thm english, fench, german or more nordic languages, as well as arabic.. But beware of the feeling you get when you cannot avoid seeing sea, the islander feeling, which can get you up.
